nodes.bodyText: Should we log something on info/warn if the user has configured a security context but no compatible config could be found at all? This would indicate that the user wanted to install some security context but misconfigured it.
The code here cannot differentiate between user-configured and default factories. If no context could be installed, I think this method will actually fail (go down a bit, installedContext == null),
+1 to this. This confused people in the past anyway.
